column4: I am trying to moutn an NFS drive with: sudo mount IP:/PATH  /mnt/MOUNTEDDRIVE
wehere do I put username/password
you don't enter a username and password with NFS in general.
It says the server said "permission denied"
NFS traditionally just acts like a normal file system and permissions are enforced based on the user/group id.
That may be that the file system isn't being exported to your host.  How is the NFS host setup?
I am not sure, but this works from the SUSE gui
does linux have such a thing?
s/linux/ubuntu/ *
on the host, what is the export line for that share, i.e. in the /etc/exports file?
NFS is often limited by IP address and the most common reason for getting permission denied is that the NFS server isn't allowing a connection from your IP for that share.
there is no /etc/exports file
try the manpage for exports on the NFS server.
it is a solaris box
oh, from solaris?
yes
alright, type "share" on the solaris host.  what does it say for the path you want to get to?
you'll want a 'rw=' entry I believe.
what version of solaris?
Thanks a lot, I figured it out
oh? What was it?
